name: Ker Sangri Paratha
history: Ker Sangri Paratha is a unique dish from the Rajasthan region of India, combining the traditional flavors of ker sangri (a desert vegetable) with the staple Indian flatbread, paratha.
description: This paratha is made by incorporating a spicy and tangy mix of ker sangri, a desert vegetable popular in Rajasthani cuisine, into the dough. The parathas are pan-fried to achieve a perfect blend of crispy and soft textures.

equipment.name: mixing bowl
equipment.description: For preparing the dough and ker sangri mixture.

instructions.title: Prepare Ker Sangri Mixture
instructions.description: Soak the dried ker sangri in water for about 2 hours. Drain and mix with red chili powder, coriander powder, amchur, and salt.

instructions.title: Make the Dough
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour with the ker sangri mixture. Gradually add water and knead to form a soft dough.

instructions.title: Roll and Cook the Parathas
instructions.description: Divide the dough into equal portions. Roll each portion into a ball and then flatten it using a rolling pin to form a round paratha. Heat a pan or tawa and cook each paratha with a little oil until golden brown on both sides.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Ker Sangri Parathas hot, accompanied by yogurt, pickle, or any curry of your choice.

tips: Ensure the ker sangri is well soaked and softened before using.
Adjust the spices as per your taste preference.
variations: Add finely chopped onions or garlic to the dough for additional flavor.
Experiment with other Rajasthani spices for different variations.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh, but can be stored for up to 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container at room temperature.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a pan for a few minutes until warm.
presentationTips: Serve on a traditional Indian thali for an authentic presentation.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves or a side of fresh salad.
